item.title: Understanding Rust Ownership
item.description: Ownership is one of the features that make it different than so many programming languages and what makes it memory safe and a good language for concurrent programming. It solves problems like null pointers, dangling pointers and data races without a garbage collector at the run time. Understanding Rust Ownership How is data stored in the program? Stack Heap Data(variables in function arguments and defined) in the stack have a known type hence the size of the data in the stack is known at the time of compilation.
